abstract: Some board members and shareholders of Topps, the baseball card maker, are furious with the company after it shunned a higher bid from its rival Upper Deck in favor of a $385 million deal with Disney’s former boss Michael D. Eisner, The New York Post reported.
lead_paragraph: Some board members and shareholders of Topps, the baseball card maker, are furious with the company after it shunned a higher bid from its rival Upper Deck in favor of a $385 million deal with Disney’s former boss Michael D. Eisner, The New York Post reported.
